docs.snippet: Why did the president release scores of State Department correspondence to the public in 1861?...
docs.abstract: Why did the president release scores of State Department correspondence to the public in 1861?

docs.snippet: Why did the president release scores of State Department correspondence to the public in 1861?...
docs.lead_paragraph: In addition to the domestic challenge it presented, the fledgling Confederacy posed a foreign policy dilemma for Abraham Lincoln's administration. The Confederacy hoped to use its position as a crucial source of cotton to secure recognition from foreign powers and boost its legitimacy, and it sent commissioners abroad to sway other countries into supporting its cause.
docs.abstract: Why did the president release scores of State Department correspondence to the public in 1861?

headline.main: Off the Mat, Into Court: Lawsuit Pits Bikram and Yoga to the People

docs.snippet: The millionaire yogi Bikram Choudhury is going after a former student to protect his copyrighted, 26-pose sequence....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thursday's 11:30 a.m. session at the Bikram Yoga NYC studio in the Flatiron District began as usual: a handful of half-dressed students slowly flapped their elbows as they decelerated their breath and stared at themselves in the mirror. After paying as much as $25 each, they began their mindful workouts in the 105-degree "Torture Chamber," while outside on Fifth Avenue, pedestrians scurried past in coats.
docs.abstract: The millionaire yogi Bikram Choudhury is going after a former student to protect his copyrighted, 26-pose sequence.

docs.snippet: When they made Tory Burch - gorgeous, successful, smart, loving - they forgot the flaws. Damn it....
docs.abstract: When they made Tory Burch - gorgeous, successful, smart, loving - they forgot the flaws. Damn it.

docs.snippet: When they made Tory Burch - gorgeous, successful, smart, loving - they forgot the flaws. Damn it....
docs.lead_paragraph: For someone like me, someone like her presents an existential problem. Conditioned as I am to peering under the surfaces of things and sussing out the dark truth, how am I to parse the enigma of transparency - the lack of discernible neuroses, the absence of characterological curveballs - that is Tory Burch? Despite her many roles as a ragingly successful business entrepreneur, divorced mother of three sons and devoted stepmother to three daughters, crack skier and tennis ace, adored friend, philanthropist, consummate hostess and general woman about town, she is disconcertingly all of a piece. There is - but how can this be? Can Dostoyevsky be all wrong? - no lurking secret self, no rattling skeletons. What you see, as God knows how many people have told me about her, ranging from her own mother to the society maven Billy Norwich, is what you get. And what you get, as far as I can tell, having spent some time with her and having talked to numerous people about her, is someone annoyingly close to perfect. Someone it would be nice to dislike, if she were only dislikable. Someone it's impossible not to envy, if only because her life seems sun drenched from the get-go, with a childhood that sounds near magical, spent climbing trees and romping with her brothers and the German shepherds her parents bred on a 35-acre gentleman's farm in Valley Forge, Pa., replete with tennis court and swimming pool.
docs.abstract: When they made Tory Burch - gorgeous, successful, smart, loving - they forgot the flaws. Damn it.

headline.main: Negotiations Under Way for Special Session in Albany on Budget Shortfall

docs.snippet: Lawmakers may be asked to return to vote on cuts to offset a shortfall in tax collections....
docs.lead_paragraph: Facing an increasingly worrisome budget outlook, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and legislative leaders are in negotiations to return to Albany for a special session later this month, an official briefed on the negotiations said on Thursday.
docs.abstract: Lawmakers may be asked to return to vote on cuts to offset a shortfall in tax collections.
